critique: This document designates the Inter-American Development Bank as a public international organization, granting it certain privileges, exemptions, and immunities. This action has minimal impact on most of the axes. It doesn't directly relate to ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. The designation is based on existing legislation (International Organizations Immunities Act and the act of Congress approving US participation in the bank), suggesting a routine administrative action within established legal frameworks.
